qas.question: Who restored the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in the 1040's?
What survives of the mosaics that adorned the walls and dome of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre?
Who left the only description of the mosaics at the Church of the Holy Sepulchre?
Where did the Russian abbot Daniel travel in 1106-07?

context: Another great undertaking by <a0_0>Constantine Monomachos<a0_0/> was the restoration of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem between 1042 and 1048. <a1_0>Nothing<a1_0/> survived of the mosaics which covered the walls and the dome of the edifice but <a2_0>the Russian abbot Daniel<a2_0/>, who visited <a3_0>Jerusalem<a3_0/> in 1106–1107 left a description: "Lively mosaics of the holy prophets are under the ceiling, over the tribune. The altar is surmounted by a mosaic image of Christ. In the main altar one can see the mosaic of the Exhaltation of Adam. In the apse the Ascension of Christ. The Annunciation occupies the two pillars next to the altar."
